Example:

import src/actim/vdom

proc buildDom: VNode =
  var testText {.global.} = "foo"

  buildVNode "div":
    handle "click":
      debugEcho vnode
      testText = "ba"

    ++ text testText

    ++ "div":
      ++ text "bla"
      ++ "br"
      ++ "a":
        attr "href": "/"
        ++ text "some link"

setRenderer buildDom

Imports

vstyles

Types

ChangeRootElementIdError = ref object of CatchableError
EventHandler = proc (e: Event)
VNode = ref object
  case isText*: bool
  of true:
    text*: string
  else:
      tag*: string
      styles*: seq[VStyle]
      stylesNode: Node
      attributes*: Table[string, string]
      childs*: seq[VNode]
      handlers*: Table[string, EventHandler]

  node*: Node

    tags: [RootEffect].}

func text(s: varargs[string, `$`]): VNode {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Create a new text vnode

Macros

macro `+>`(head, body: untyped)
Add child by calling a proc

Example:

template drawInfoBox(title: string, body: untyped): VNode =
  buildVNode "div":
    attr "class": "info-box"
    ++ "div":
      attr "class": "title"
      ++ text title
    body

buildVNode "div":
  +> drawInfoBox "foo":
    ++ text "lorem ipsum"
macro attr(a, val: untyped)
Set an attribute of node.

Example:

buildVNode "a":
  attr "href": "/"
  ++ text "home"
macro handle(kind, body: untyped)
Add event handler to node

Example:

buildVNode input:
  attr "type": "text"
  handle "click":
    echo vnode.attributes.value
macro style(vstyle: VStyle | seq[VStyle])
Add vstyle(s) to node.

Example:

buildVNode "div":
  ++ text "foo"
  style: newVStyle:
    "padding": 5.px
    "background-color": "#44ffaa"

Templates

template `++`(tag: string) {.dirty.}
template `++`(tag: string; body: untyped) {.dirty.}
template `++`(vn: VNode | seq[VNode]) {.dirty.}
template buildVNode(tag: string; body: untyped): VNode
Build a node with childs/attributes/handlers 
template buildVNodes(body: untyped): seq[VNode]

Example:

buildVNodes:
  ++ "b":
    ++ text "foo"
  ++ text "ba"
template extendVNode(base: VNode; body: untyped): VNode
Extend an existing node. Using the same syntax as buildVNode
